page.title: 19LOCAL ADMINISTRATION.PT.2
page.content: In the constituency he has to deal with the problems people bring to him,the progress of local industries and a safe enviroment.In Parliament he puts forward his own views and those of his constituents.He is at present a Conservative.Each area then has its own parish or town council,according to its size.Southwold has a{town {council.}It has{12}members and is re_ elected every{4}years.It meets once a month and gets most of its money from renting the many buildings it owns.It also owns the marshes and the common.Southwold,however,also receives money annually by precept from the{WDC Reydon has a parish council of{15 councillors.Its precept for the current financial year is{Â£2,700}from WDC.Both Reydon and Southwold have a penny rate.
